text: An unmarked cop CAR GUNS through traffic, cherry top flashing. Slides through a turn. SCREECHES to a stop.
MARTIN RIGGS driving, ROGER MURTAUGH riding shotgun. Both stunned at what they're seeing.
Oh, shit...

Hell. A dozen different fires light the street. In the center of it all, two blocks away, walking away from them, squirting a flamethrower with one hand and FIRING an AK-47 with the other, a human tank wearing level-3, full-body armor, facemask, etc. He napalms another car.
What're we gonna do?
Run him over. Riggs FLOORS it at the guy.
What if he turns and shoots us with that friggin assault rifle?
Maybe he won't. He hasn't yet.
Right. But what if he does?
Try being positive for once, Rog. We're cops.
Unlike you, my life matters to me.
You got another way to stop him? (CONTINUED)
«+. No. Okay, you're right, we're cops... I hope he doesn't turn.
Then do be a Do-bee, don't be a Don't-bee. Will him not to turn.
Will him.
Will him. Yeah. C'mon... (chants ) --- Don't turn, don't turn... C'mon, Rog, will him with me...
(beat; what the hell) Don't turn, don't turn...
--- Don't turn, don't turn...
He's turning.
Oh, shit.

The CAR SKIDS sideways as Riggs throws the wheel over. The human TANK OPENS UP on them. BULLETS SHRED the vehicle. Riggs and Murtaugh bail out and take cover behind the wheels. There's fire all around them.
Had to turn so my side faced him?
There's no right turn here. The shooting stops. Riggs and Murtaugh pop up FIRING. SLUGS BOUNCE off the guy's body armor. They drop back.
We're in trouble.
It's your fault, Rog. (CONTINUED)
My fault? How's it my fault? I said the words.
You said 'em. But I know you didn't believe ‘em. Murtaugh rolls his eyes. Peeks. The human tank's walking toward them. MORE BULLETS. He torches a kiosk.
Okay. I'll draw his fire. You run for cover.
No, no, no. I'1l draw the fire, and you run for cover.
I got less to lose, so you do the running.
You're younger, in love --
And you got a wife and kids. Are you nuts, Rog? I got lots less to lose. I'm going first.
Riggs...
Get ready to run, Rog.
... I'm not supposed to tell you this, but... Lorna's pregnant. You're gonna be a father. Riggs wasn't expecting that one.
She's afraid to tell you. You never discussed having children.
+. That kid with the crayon...
What kid? (CONTINUED)
He draws stuff and it comes to life... Draws the moon so he can walk in the moonlight... Purple crayon... Don't remember his name... Just popped into my head when you... A baby...
Yeah, a baby. And I'm older, and I've been a dad, so I'm going first.
(then) You can't go first, Rog.
Why not?
‘Cause there's something I'm not supposed to tell you, too... Rianne's pregnant. You're gonna be a grandfather.
Rianne can't be pregnant. She's not married... Oh, shit...

It was an accident. She and the guy aren't serious... She was gonna tell you this weekend when you were nice and relaxed. Riggs peeks at the human tank, now standing a short distance away with his gun leveled. Riggs ducks back as BULLETS RAKE the car again. Murtaugh looks sick.
Not sure I want to live now.
The kid needs a grandad, Rog... Take off your clothes.
‘Scuse me?
Strip, Rog. Fast. (CONTINUED)
What the hell for?
You run. He turns. Seeing you in your undies distracts him -- it'd distract me -- and that's when I shoot.
Shoot what?
The one place he's vulnerable --
You mean gonna shoot him in the --
No, not there. The valve of that napalm tank.
You're gonna hit a little bitty valve before he shoots me?
-.-. Trust me, Rog.
Trust you? Beat. Murtaugh starts stripping.
I gotta be crazy.
A second ago, you didn't care if you lived.
That was before the prospect of ending up dead in my underwear.
Just hurry, Rog. It's getting a little warm here.
++. Is he black?
Can't tell with all that armor. (CONTINUED)
Not him. The father of the baby. He's black, right?
I don't know.
Please let him be black. Not the blond kid with pits in his face. .+. Bad enough she did that condom commercial. She could've at least used 'em
C'mon, c'mon...
(finishes undressing) I don't wanna die in my underwear. Riggs looks. Murtaugh's wearing pink satin boxers.
What's --
Not now.
Are those pink --
Not now. Just hit the damn tank. Riggs drops it. They get set to move.
Also, flap your arms and make noises like a bird.
What for?
It'll distract him more. I need him to turn. Ready? On two.
On two? We always go on three.
Change of pace, okay? One, two -- (CONTINUED)

Murtaugh bolts from behind the car, flapping his arms and making noises like Riggs told him. The guy turns... and the sight does make him pause. Just long enough for Riggs to stand and SHOOT. Riggs' slug tears off the stem of the flamethrower tank, releasing napalm in a high-pressure, burning jet that rockets the human tank off the ground and through the air toward a nearby gas station. He impacts a gas pump. Fuel ignites. The STATION EXPLODES. A tanker TRUCK offloading gas is BLOWN upward OUT OF FRAME. Riggs and Murtaugh watch the inferno. Beat.
I'm too young to be a grandfather.
What about me? I'm gonna be someone's dad.
«+. Think that bird thing really helped?
Nah, I just wanted to see if you'd do it. Something catches their eye. They look up.

Oh, shit! They start running. A moment later, the tanker drops from the sky behind them. A few tons of metal falling at 9.81 meters/second/second. Right onto their car... Riggs and Murtaugh get to safety. Look back. Beat.
Never a dull moment, huh, Rog?
Not since I met you. AD LIBS: 1) Wasn't that a gas? 2) That's oil, folks. MAIN TITLES.  10 11
A detail of Red Chinese soldiers waits outside the gates.

The gates open. More PRC soldiers escort out four Chinese men wearing prisoners' shock belts. The oldest of the four is in his 70s, dignified. The youngest is 50ish and menacing, eye like a pit viper... They're led toward a vehicle in a waiting convoy. A young PRC soldier touches the older man's arm to help him in. Ina flash, the pit viper strikes the soldier dead for the offense. Executes a gravity-defying flying double kick that snaps the soldier's neck. Another soldier quickly jabs a button on a remote control unit. 50,000 volts from the shock belts jolt the prisoner's bodies. Three of them drop instantly to the ground in agony... Not the pit viper... Incredibly, he stays on his feet. Teeth gritted. Muscles quivering from the punishing electric current. Staring back at his tormenter. A full ten seconds... The soldier releases the button. The flow of electricity stops... As the pit viper moves to help the old man up --
The four prisoners and the PRC Army guard detail board a large, commercial-type jet. The door's shut and sealed.
CLOSE ON a navigation plotter. Destination: L.A.
The jet takes off into the dark sky.
Murtaugh's boat bobs on the sea.

A 12-foot, live shark thrashes madly inside the cockpit, jaws snapping. REVEAL Riggs, Murtaugh, and LEO GETZ looking down at it from the tuna tower. Clearly, they've scrambled there to escape the furious beast. (CONTINUED)
That shark damages my new boat, I'm taking it outta you, Leo.
I didn't mean to catch it.
Then why do you want to keep it?
Yeah, what the hell you want a a shark for?
The teeth'1l look good on a wall.
They gotta stop snapping first.
«+. Maybe it'll go to sleep.
Go have a conversation with it.
Doesn't look tired to me.
Eating Leo might wear it out.
Ha-ha.
It's a thought.
Fun-ny.
Do sharks eat their own kind?
Stop, I'm in stitches. Riggs and Murtaugh move to grab Leo. Leo moves away.
Okay, okay... It's my fish, I'll take care of it. Leo moves off, down a hatch into the cabin. (CONTINUED)
The shark 10.
Why'd we bring Leo along, anyway?
He said you invited him.
He told me you did. thrashes some more.
...-Last guy trip before the baby's here.... It's all about to change, Rog.
Easy on the boat, shark! Leo pops his head out of the hatch.
Where's my bag?
Starboard side aft.
Starboard. That's left.
Port's left. Starboard's right.
'Right,' yeah. Right side aft. Leo disappears again. Beat.
Riggs... I've kept my nose out of it, but you and Lorna... you're having a baby... you're living together... you're not getting married...
That violate your family values, Rog?
Just trying to understand -- (CONTINUED)
I mean, Rianne's not exactly married either, is she?
... That's below the belt.
«+. You're right. I'm sorry... I was married once before, Rog. She's dead 'cause I'm a cop.
That was a terrible thing. But Lorna's a cop, too. I don't see the problem.
The problem... The problem is, maybe I don't wear the wedding ring anymore, Rog, but I look down, and it's still there. The two men share a long look. Leo pops up again.
You did say aft.
A-f-t. Aft.
And that's a fucking word?
Back of the cabin, right side.
So why not just say that?... People get around water, they gotta talk all that nautical shit. Leo disappears again. Murtaugh turns back to Riggs.
What's Lorna say about this?
We haven't talked about it.
A few days 'til the baby's due, and you haven't talked about marriage at_all? (CONTINUED)
Do we want Leo to shoot the shark?
Do we want Leo to shoot the shark? REVEAL Leo's about to shoot the shark with a pistol.
No, Leo! Murtaugh jumps, wrests the gun from him.
Jeez. What's the big deal?
You're shooting a gun in my boat!
I was just gonna kill Jaws there.
Nobody's killing it. I'm not letting a good animal die just so you can have its teeth, Leo.
You're crankier since finding out you're gonna be a grandpa. (CONTINUED)
(re: gun) This isn't mine or Rog's.
I got my P.I. license now, right?... A gumshoe sometimes finds himself in ugly situations.
You're an ugly situation, period.
It's illegal to carry a weapon without a permit. Riggs tosses the gun in the sea. Blam! A GUNSHOT.

Was that Leo's gun? BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! From the other direction. They turn... and there's the bow of a two-hundred-foot freighter about to run them down. Leo screams. Murtaugh leaps to the helm. Jams the throttle ahead full. The boat jumps forward... and the freighter rushes by, inches away, snagging fishing lines, pulling poles from sockets. And then it's gone.
My boat... Thank God...
The gunfire came from the ship. Let's go, Rog.
Go where?
After it. Someone could be in trouble.
«+. I'll radio the Coast Guard.
Fine. And we'll go after it. Riggs moves to the helm, jams down the THROTTLE. (CONTINUED)
Hey! Careful! (takes the helm) I'll drive. You hurt things. I don't want my new boat hurt. (snags the VHS) Coast Guard, 'Code 7,' Coast Guard, 'Code 7,' over.
Leo, get our guns and badges. Leo goes. Over the RADIO, we hear --
"Code 7,' this is Coast Guard Group L.A. Long Beach, go ahead.
Coast Guard, 'Code 7.' This is Sgt. Murtaugh, L.A.P.D. Want to report gun shots aboard a freighter headed due north approximately one mile from L.A. Harbor. Over.
‘Code 7,' what is the name of the vessel? Over.
(Name). Outta Hong Kong. Over.
Roger, 'Code 7.' Wait one. Leo reappears with badges and guns. Re: Riggs' pistol!--
New Beretta?
Testing a laser sight for the department. He aims at Leo. A red laser dot appears on Leo's nose.
Got a mole you want removed?
Hey, don't fuck with that. (CONTINUED)
"Code 7,' Coast Guard. We have a cutter en route, over.
Coast Guard, 'Code 7.' Copy. ‘Code 7' out. (CONTINUED)
Then, to Riggs, as they pull in behind the ship --
We'll just hang here safe and outta sight 'til the Coast Guard arrives. Whereupon a searchlight on the ship suddenly illuminates them. Beat.
What now?
... Show 'em our badges? They hold up badges. Multiple WEAPONS OPEN UP on them. Murtaugh throws the helm over as Riggs FIRES BACK. Nails the searchlight. Keeps FIRING.

One of the shooters takes a bullet. Knocks over the searchlight as he goes down FIRING. SLUGS PUNCTURE a stack of kerosene drums lashed topside. Leaking fuel reaches the broken searchlight, still sparking on the deck. The FUEL IGNITES. The DRUMS EXPLODE.
The Chinese captain looks back as another fuel DRUM EXPLODES. The stern's engulfed in flame. He yells to the crew (italics indicate Chinese) --
Abandon ship! As people leave their positions to abandon ship --
A short distance away. Watching the fireworks on the freighter. No one's shooting at them now. They see a lifeboat lower from the freighter. (CONTINUED)
They're trying to get away. Let's get over there, Rog.
Coast Guard'll be here any minute.
And those guys'1ll be gone. Beat. Murtaugh relents, steers for the ship.
They better not shoot up my boat. Leo peeks out from somewhere.
Helluva fucking fishing trip.
Shut up and keep your head down. Murtaugh pulls up alongside the lifeboat as it hits the water, still tethered to the ship. Riggs jumps aboard the bouncing craft, surprising two crewmen within.

Ahoy. They move to shoot Riggs. Riggs NAILS both. But a bullet parts one end of the line Riggs is holding -- a line rigged up to the ship -- and suddenly, Riggs is SHOOTING up into the air. Ina flash, he's hauled to the davits, drops to --  17 18 19 20 21 18.
in the midst of other heavily-armed crewmen.
You're under arrest. Someone OPENS UP on him, and the GUNFIGHT's on.
The untended wheel turns slowly... pointing the ship toward the not-so-distant lights of L.A.
Murtaugh watches the freighter turn.
It's heading for the beach.

The ship approaches the shore. Riggs ends one GUNFIGHT and gets into another, finally engaging a gunman at the very tip of the ship's bow. The gunman's behind a large winch, pins Riggs down with an automatic weapon. Riggs can't hit him and can't run... when he sees the ship's metal gunwale converging behind the gunman. Quickly eyeballs the angles involved. Aims the laser down the gunwale. FIRES. Banks a slug off the steel. Takes out the gunman with a ricochet... whereupon the ship runs aground. The abrupt stop topples cranes, everything not fastened down, and tosses Riggs hard against a winch, knocking his gun away... Remaining crew throw lines over to jump ship. Riggs shakes off the blow from the winch. Catches the ship's Captain heading for the side. The Captain whips a kung fu move on him. kK.O.s Riggs... The Captain moves toward a rope. Two crewmen are in line to go down. The Captain's not in a waiting mood. Pulls a GUN, SHOOTS them both off the ship. Grabs the rope and slides down.
Murtaugh's followed the freighter in, stays just beyond the surf line near the beached ship.
Holy shit. That was great. Wasn't that great? (CONTINUED)
21 CONTINUED: (Al)
Hope Riggs is okay. Leo regards the shark, now motionless in the cockpit. (CONTINUED)
I think the shark's asleep now. BOOM! Another EXPLOSION up on the ship's deck. Murtaugh looks up to see a burning OIL DRUM blown high into the air. He follows the drum's trajectory.
Oh, shit... Jump, Leo. Murtaugh shoves Leo off the boat... just as the heavy, fiery drum crushes it. The boat instantly begins sinking. Murtaugh bobs near Leo, looking on.
My boat... As the boat goes down, water begins to cover the shark and... revives it.
I think the shark's awake again.
Oh, shit! Murtaugh and Leo begin stroking madly as the shark swims free of the wreckage. Leo urges himself on.
Swim, swim, swim... Murtaugh sees the lifeboat, still tied to the freighter, drifting behind it. He swims over and climbs aboard. Then calls to Leo, paddling frantically nearby --
Leo, this way! Over here! Leo sees Murtaugh, alters course for the boat. He glances back. The shark's coming for him.
Agh! Swim! Swim! Swim! The shark closes quickly on the little guy. It's about to nail him... when Murtaugh grabs Leo's shirt, hauls him into the lifeboat. They tumble onto the floorboards.
You see that? Fucking shark almost ate me. (CONTINUED)
What you get for trying to take his teeth. Murtaugh stands, watches his boat sink from sight. Beat.
Since meeting Riggs, I've had my house destroyed, my car wrecked, and my boat sunk... What's left?
That's pretty much it. Murtaugh sees a "Code 7" life ring floating next to the lifeboat. He picks it up. All that's left of his boat.

Riggs is slowly coming around from the karate chop. Finds his gun. Stands. There's a CREAK behind him. Riggs spins. A hatch is opening. Riggs aims. The laser pinpoints an old Chinese woman emerging. Behind her are more Chinese. Other hatches open. Riggs lowers his gun, watches, stunned, as seemingly endless numbers of ragged, tired, and frightened Chinese men, women, and children slowly emerge onto the deck.
Coast Guard, LAPD, LAFD, INS -- you name it, they're there, plus news crews and looky-loos. The Chinese have been corralled by INS near the boat.
Riggs, Murtaugh and an INS AGENT look down at the Chinese herded together on the beach.
Coast Guard interdicts about one of these a month.
Raggedy-looking folks.
Six weeks locked in a hold with one toilet. Rice and a little fish to eat... Lousy deal for thirty-five grand a head. (CONTINUED)
Thirty-five grand? Where'd they get that kind of money?
Didn't. Gotta work it off. Snakeheads, the smugglers, they sell ‘em as cheap labor.
Sell ‘em?
Like slaves. We see the word register with Murtaugh.
Women and girls're forced into prostitution. Rest earn seventy cents an hour in the sweatshops.
They gotta work off thirty-five G's making seventy cents an hour?
Takes years. Then the debt's gone, and the people're used up. From work, from drugs, from living two to a bed in some rat hole 'til they quit caring.
What about these people here?
They'11 claim asylum, say they were persecuted, like everybody else. We'll end up sending 'em back. Cost a goddamn fortune.
What happened to 'Bring me your tired, your poor, your wretched masses yearning to be free'?
Now it reads 'no vacancies’... You'd think word'd get back, and they'd give us a break, but they don't. Snakehead biz is booming. He indicates the shot-up corpse of a Chinese man nearby. (CONTINUED)
They pop one every boatload. Shows the rest what'll happen if they run off or don't pay. Murtaugh regards the body a moment.
‘Least he's no one's slave now. Beat. Riggs looks up, sees LEE BUTTERS approaching. Butters is a junior-grade detective, twenties, black.
That kid's here -- what's his name !--
It's a food. Burgers? Bagels?
Breadsticks?
Biscuits?
Butters.
Right. Butters. Always kisses my ass. Gets me coffee 'n shit.
Probably looks up to you. You're a role model. An elder statesman.
He wants to be like me, he shouldn't be kissing butt.
(walks up) Sergeant Riggs, Sergeant Murtaugh -- what're you doing here?
Long story.
(to Murtaugh) You're all wet, sir. You need a blanket or something? (CONTINUED)
Before Murtaugh can say "no" --
I need a couple blankets here! Someone hands him blankets. He gives both to Murtaugh.
Here you go, sir.
(mot happy) Thanks, Burgers.
Butters.
Got a homicide over there. A troubled look crosses Butters' face.
Homicide?
You're a homicide detective.
There's two more over the side. Butters crosses. Looks under the sheet.
Goddamn it! Riggs and Murtaugh don't understand the sudden reaction.
What?
He was shot!
Yeah.
Four times! At close range! Like he was executed!
He was executed.
The crew did it. (CONTINUED)
That really pisses me off! Riggs and Murtaugh exchange a look.

Folks're getting killed left, right, and center in this town! Now we're importing victims. Gang-bangers wanna cap each other, no problem! Shoot it out with the cops -- boom, you're dead, who cares? Some poor guy just trying to get through the shit 24-7-365, and he's whacked, that really pisses me off!
Easy, Biscuits.
(beat; calmer) Just don't like it when people do bad things to good folks.
... Listen, Bagels, it's been a long night. We'll catch you tomorrow, okay?
Yeah. Okay. Be sure to dry off, Sergeant Murtaugh. Murtaugh just nods. He and Murtaugh head off.
Takes the job kinda personally.
Loud, too.
Walking. Riggs groans from the karate chop.
You okay?
Guy caught me with one. Fast. 25. 24 25 (CONTINUED)
Too fast for you? The question hangs there. Murtaugh suddenly stops.
Left something in the lifeboat.

I'll get a patrol car to drop me at my truck. See you tomorrow... Sorry about your boat, Rog. I know it meant a lot. They share a look. Then Riggs heads off. Murtaugh goes to the beached lifeboat. Retrieves the "Code 7" life ring. In doing so, leans on the tarp covering the boat's forward half. A MUFFLED CRY. Beat. Murtaugh lifts the tarp, revealing ten Chinese -- men, women and children. Frightened stowaways, huddled together...

UNCLE BENNY CHAN's seventies, wearing all Ralph Lauren Polo. Sitting with Benny, slightly apart, is WAH SING KU, thirty, discerning, full of dangerous potentials we can only guess at right now. Dressed in Shanghai Tang, modern clothes with classical Chinese touches, qualities Ku possesses. Both men, plus an Uncle Benny enforcer, YEE, have their attention focused on GEORGE PROODY, a young State Department suit holding up a sheaf of papers.
Four sets of papers. Totally genuine. They'll get in the country, and they'll be able to stay. Forever. U.S. citizens. He hands the papers to Benny.
Ask 'em to vote the incumbent party next election. Help me keep my job with the State Department.
(eyeing reports) Bloody marvelous...
They've red-flagged all Asian visas lately. Those weren't easy to slip through. (CONTINUED)
(looks up; warmly) You've been a big help. We're very grateful. Another enforcer, CHU, enters with information. Looks at Ku, who indicates it's okay for him to speak. (In Chinese (subtitles).
«+. The ship went aground.
(controlled agitation) What about the merchandise?
It's missing.
I'll find out about it immediately. The look Ku gives Benny is shaming, and Benny feels it.
Something wrong?
(instant charm again) Small delivery problem... Thank you, Mr. Proody. Benny nods to Yee. Yee hands Proody a bundle of cash. Proody scans it. He's satisfied. Beat.

Good night. Proody is suddenly wary of his situation. Knows he's vulnerable now. Knows they're killers. With an eye on the room, he goes... After which Ku pulls a loop of Buddhist prayer beads from a pocket and fingers them, lost in dark meditation, while no one else speaks.
Proody moves to a parked car. Watchful. Hand ona pistol we now see he's had stuck in his waistband.  28 29 30 31 32 28.
He gets in. Puts his key in the ignition. Hesitates. Is it gonna blow? Takes his chances. The CAR STARTS without incident. Proody peels out. Sighs. Smiles. He's alive and ten thousand bucks richer.
Next to the L.A. River. Lights flash as the barricade lowers. In the distance, a train headlight. Proody's car pulls up and stops.

The train nearing. Proody dreaming about what he'll do with the bribe-money... when smash!... his CAR'S suddenly STRUCK hard from behind. Proody looks back. No headlights... Just the grill of a truck... He fumbles for the gun... Blinding light from the train fills the car. Proody can't react in time... The truck shoves him onto the tracks, in front of the speeding train.

The TRAIN SLAMS into Proody's car. Launches. it. The twisted wreckage flips through the air toward the concret contained river. Drops onto the cement bank. EXPLODES as it rolls into the water... As hundred-dollar bills scatte in the wind, the back seat window of the truck rolls down revealing Ku. Ku regards the flaming wreck down the track amoment. Puts away his prayer beads. Rolls up the window... As the truck drives off --
Riggs pulls up in his truck. We see he's still aching from the karate chop as he moves to the front door. Eating French fries out of fast food sack.  33 34 29.
Riggs unlocks the door, steps in, and... freezes mid- fry as a cocked pistol is put to his head. Beat.
Hi, honey. REVEAL LORNA COLE, nightie, nine millimeter, nine months pregnant. She lowers the gun.
You were coming home last night.

Had some bad Chinese. As they continue, we see the place has been transformed. Additions, wings, decks, etc. open out from the old trail A woman's touch everywhere. Their two dogs and one cat greet Riggs and vice versa. Lorna sees how dirty and banged up he is.
You okay?
Better than Roger. His boat sank. He feeds the dogs some fries.
Don't feed 'em that junk. What happened?
Gunfights, sharks, explosions... The usual.
«+. You were out fishing. Does trouble just go looking for you?
No, it seems to know pretty much where I am most of the time. Riggs sees into a newly-added room.
You finished the nursery.
Riggs enters with Lorna, looks around. Baby to the max. Major puppy motif. (CONTINUED)
I figured it was good for a girl or a boy. Cute, huh?
Lotta puppies.
I know. I got on this puppy thing and just couldn't stop. (to her tummy) Hope you like doggies, baby. Beat. Riggs spins a mobile over the crib.
Lorna... We... We've never talked about... marriage. Lorna looks up at him. It could be a hopeful look.
I sorta figured you didn't want that... You want to get married?
Well... No.
Whew. Me, either. Want breakfast?
(that was easy; re: fast food) Got mine.
Lorna emerges, goes to the kitchen. Riggs follows her out. The DOGS are BARKING at the door.
You guys want to go out? C'mon. He opens the door, lets the dogs out.

Riggs exits after the hounds. Sees a paperback romance on a chair and snags it. The author's "Ebony Clark." Riggs is reading a passage as Lorna emerges with cereal, milk, etc. Re the book -- (CONTINUED)
You bought this smut?
(looks over) It's not smut, it's Ebony Clark. Trish gave it to me.
«+. Can we try this thing they do on page 22 sometime?
Not now. Nothing comes between a pregnant lady and a meal.
(beat; still reading) Have I ever made your ‘womanhood reach peaks that would rival the highest Himalayas'?
The foothills of Malibu maybe. No Everests.
Thanks a lot.
Just kidding. I've been to lots of mountaintops with you, Riggs.
Riggs and Lorna are eating. Riggs keeps feeding the dogs surreptitiously.
I dropped by Internal Affairs yesterday. Y'know, to say hi.
How's things with the rat squad?
They miss me... The vet said not to feed 'em anything but dog food, Riggs. It's bad for 'em. (CONTINUED)
(to the dogs) Sorry, boys. You heard the boss.
(beat) Overheard one thing at the office.
What?
I.A.'s got an anonymous tip... The person said Roger's on the take.
Roger? That's crazy.

Of course it is. It's someone with a grudge against him. Probably some jerk he put away... But with the new boats all the time and putting two kids through private college, it's caused conversation. Anyway, I thought you should know. I'1l tell you if it goes anywhere.
«+. Straight-arrow Rog on the take. That'd be the day.
Just don't tell him, okay? He'll blow his top, and I'll be in hot water. And he's got enough problems as it is anyway.
Like what?
«+. Oh... Oops...
What's oops?
Pregnancy's destroyed my brain... It cannot leave here, Riggs. Under any circumstances. (CONTINUED)
Okay. What? What is it?
-+.» You know how Roger is about his daughters going out with cops.
He'd kill ‘em. Yeah? So?
So Rianne's married to one. He's the father of her baby. She's too scared to tell Roger.
Whoa, whoa, whoa. Back up... Rianne's married?
To a cop. They met last year. They fell in love. She got pregnant. They got hitched.
And no one's telling Rog.
After the baby's born.
‘Here's the whole package, take it or leave it'?
I'm not saying it was a good idea.
It's a good idea if you want to see Rog's head explode... What about Trish?
She knows.
Who's the lucky soon-to-be-dead man?
--.- Sgt. Lee Butters. (CONTINUED)
.-. Biscuits?... This just gets better and better.
No one thought he'd be transferred downtown with you guys.
No wonder he's been sucking up to Rog.
You cannot tell him, Riggs.
You kidding? He'd shoot me for being the messenger... Question is how to have fun with it.
This is serious. Don't screw around.
